markdown.headingText: Add root to path so utils/ can be imported
markdown.markdown:
```{python} #| echo: false #| global: true import sys import os import altair as alt sys.path.append(os.path.abspath(".")) alt.renderers.enable('default') os.makedirs("outputs", exist_ok=True) # Import visualization functions from py.photo_effect_plot import plot_photo_effect from py.case_type_bar import plot_case_type from py.income_dot_map import plot_income_dot_map from py.income_choropleth import plot_income_choropleth from py.subset_selection_plot import plot_subset_selection ``` > **"Cities speak through their systems."** > This dashboard listens closely to what San Francisco's 311 requests reveal — about equity, efficiency, and responsiveness. # Behind Every Service Request, a Story When a streetlight goes dark or a sidewalk cracks, a resident might reach for their phone and dial 311. In doing so, they become a data point — one of over half a million calls made in San Francisco between 2012 and 2018. But who gets help fastest? Where does the system lag — and why? This dashboard explores the people, patterns, and disparities embedded in city service data. Scroll to uncover the story.
## Resolution Rates by Neighborhood This interactive map visualizes how well each neighborhood's requests are resolved. Try toggling between requests **with** and **without** photo evidence to see the impact.
## The Power of Photo Evidence Cases with photos are resolved nearly **30% faster** on average. This bar chart makes the difference clear:
```{python} plot_photo_effect() ```
Download interactive chart as HTML
## Which Case Types Get Resolved? Some services are handled efficiently; others fall through the cracks. This chart ranks the top 10 case types by resolution rate.
```{python} plot_case_type() ```
Download interactive chart as HTML
## Income Disparities Across Neighborhoods Hover over this dot map to see average income by neighborhood. How does income relate to resolution speed?
```{python} plot_income_dot_map() ```
Download interactive chart as HTML
## Income Distribution: Choropleth Map A broader look at geographic inequality in income levels: ```{python} plot_income_choropleth() ```
Download map as HTML
## Subset Selection: The Most Predictive Features Using R² and BIC, we identify the most impactful predictors of resolution success.
```{python} plot_subset_selection() ```
Download interactive chart as HTML
## Key Takeaways
Photo evidence speeds up service.
Resolution rates are uneven across income and racial lines.
Case type matters — some requests are much more likely to be resolved.
## Why This Matters Municipal data isn't just numbers. It's a record of who gets served, and who doesn't. In a city striving for equity, these patterns must be visible — so they can be challenged and changed.
## Scan to View on Mobile

Scan to view this dashboard on your phone
